metadata.title: CVE-2023-1838 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in vhost_net_set_backend indrivers/vhost/net.c in virtio network subcomponent in the Linux kernel dueto a double fget. This flaw could allow a local attacker to crash thesystem, and could even lead to a kernel information leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-224-generic - 4.15.0-224.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-224-generic - 4.15.0-224.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-224-lowlatency - 4.15.0-224.236
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1151-kvm - 4.15.0-1151.156
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1167-aws - 4.15.0-1167.180
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-azure - 4.15.0-1176.191
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-gcp - 4.15.0-1161.178
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-oracle - 4.15.0-1130.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-224.236').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.156').
